meanings.definition: The action of preventing something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The preclusion of rain ruined our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: His preclusion of distractions helped him focus on his studies.
meanings.sent3: The preclusion of the dog from the party made everyone wonder why.
meanings.sent4: Her preclusion of negative thoughts was like building a fortress around her mind.
meanings.sent5: The preclusion of sunlight in the cave created an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The state of being excluded or ruled out.
meanings.sent1: Her preclusion from the team left her feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent2: The preclusion of certain foods from his diet made meal planning challenging.
meanings.sent3: The preclusion of the cat from the room led to a peaceful nap.
meanings.sent4: His preclusion from the secret club felt like a rejection.
meanings.sent5: The preclusion of the old tradition brought about new ideas and perspectives.

meanings.definition: The act of making something impossible.
meanings.sent1: The preclusion of errors in the calculations ensured accurate results.
meanings.sent2: His preclusion of any doubts made him confident in his decision.
meanings.sent3: The preclusion of the squirrel from reaching the bird feeder was a clever move.
meanings.sent4: Her preclusion of failure drove her to work harder than ever.
meanings.sent5: The preclusion of escape routes trapped the characters in a thrilling adventure.
